alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 08 at 4:33PM AKDT until October 10 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 7 PM AKDT MONDAY FOR THE BRISTOL BAY COAST FROM EGEGIK SOUTH... ...THIS REPLACES THE PREVIOUS COASTAL FLOOD WATCH... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a High Surf Advisory, which is in effect from 10 AM to 7 PM AKDT Monday. This replaces the Coastal Flood Watch. * LOCATION...The Bristol Bay Coast from Egegik, south. * WAVES AND SURF...Water levels are expected to rise 2 to 4 feet above the normal highest tide line with this surf. * TIMING...The primary impact period will be at around high tide early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is the potential for coastal erosion due to the high surf.
info.instruction: A high surf advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing rip currents and localized beach erosion.
